intro: Parsonsia capsularis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered parsonsia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant features opposite, simple, and usually lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are typically clustered in umbels. The fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy in the family. It is often found in coastal and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments.
